channel.title: Working MAC-address changer for using with Debian/Whonix
channel.description: The MAC changers that have always been shipped with most Linux distro's, often did not work well on some Wlan adapters. But Tails now has a working MAC-address changer that works well. Is there a similar working MAC spoofing application for Debian (using Whonix TwoVM or Physical Isolation).

item.title: Working MAC-address changer for using with Debian/Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Don’t get me wrong. It seems to me, that the Tails devs have done what is within their abilities (which is more than I could come up with!), but that their macchanger is still too fragile and entangled into Tails and GDM, coming with many limitations. Just read their fine design document:
https://tails.boum.org/contribute/design/MAC_address/ And you’ll see what limitations I am talking about.

Read full topic
item.source: Working MAC-address changer for using with Debian/Whonix

item.title: Working MAC-address changer for using with Debian/Whonix
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Unfortunately, not. No one has ported the Tails specific macchanger to general Linux yet and to my knowledge, no one is working on it. Help welcome!

Read full topic
item.source: Working MAC-address changer for using with Debian/Whonix
